p.span: This profile defines the expected capabilities of the US Core Client conforming to the US Core IG.

ol.li: Support fetching and querying of one or more US Core profile(s), using the supported RESTful interactions and search parameters declared in the US Core Server CapabilityStatement
implement the security requirements documented in the US-Core IG.

div.h4: Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-patient

ul.li: A client has connected to a server and fetched a patient using GET [base]/Patient/[id].

A client has connected to a server and searched through available Patients using at least 2 (example name and gender) of the following search parameters:
name
gender
birthdate

div.p: To limit overly broad search results, a client search with gender SHOULD include family and given name search parameters.

div.h4: Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-allergintolerance

ul.li: A client has connected to a server and fetched a patient's allergies using GET /AllergyIntolerance?patient=[id].

div.h4: Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-careplan

ul.li: A client has connected to a server and fetched all of a patient's Assessment and Plan of Treatment information using GET /CarePlan?patient=[id]&category=assess-plan.

A client has connected to a server and fetched all of a patient's Assessment and Plan of Treatment information over a specified time period using GET /CarePlan?patient=[id]&category=assess-plan&date=[date].

A client SHOULD be capable of connecting to a server and fetching all of a patient's active Assessment and Plan of Treatment information using GET /CarePlan?patient=[id]&category=assess-plan&status=active.

A client SHOULD be capable of connecting to a server and fetching all of a patient's active Assessment and Plan of Treatment information over a specified time period using GET /CarePlan?patient=[id]&category=assess-plan&status=active&date=[date].

div.h4: Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-careteam

ul.li: A client is able to connect to a server and fetch all current care team members for a patient using GET[base]/CareTeam?patient=[id]&status=active

div.h4: Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-condition

ul.li: A client connected to a server and fetched all problems and health concerns for a patient, including current as well as historical problems and health concerns using GET/Condition?patient=[id]

div.h4: Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-device

ul.li: A client has connected to a server and fetched all Unique device identifier(s)(UDI)for a patient's implantable device(s)using GET /Device?patient=[id].

div.h4: Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-goal

ul.li: A client has connected to a server and fetched all of a patient's goals using GET [base]/Goal?patient=[id].
A client has connected to a server and fetched all of a patient's goals over a specified time period using GET [base]/Goal?patient=[id]&date=[date]{&date=[date]}.

div.h4: Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-immunization

ul.li: A client has connected to a server and fetched all immunizations for a patient using GET /Immunization?patient=[id].

p.strong: Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-diagnosticreport

ul.li: A client has connected to a server and fetched all of a patient's laboratory diagnostic reports by searching by category using GET [base]/DiagnosticReport?patient=[id]&category=LAB.

A client has connected to a server and fetched all of a patient's laboratory diagnostic reports searching by category code and date range using GET [base]/DiagnosticReport?patient=[id]&category=LAB&date=[date]{&date=[date]}.

A client has connected to a server and fetched all of all of a patient's laboratory diagnostic reports searching by category and code using GET [base]/DiagnosticReport?patient=[id]&category=LAB&code=[LOINC].

A client SHOULD be capable of connecting to a server and fetching any of a patient's laboratory diagnostic reports searching by category and one or more codes and date range using GET [base]/DiagnosticReport?patient=[id]&category=LAB&code=[LOINC1{,LOINC2,LOINC3,...}]&date=[date]{&date=[date]}.

a.span: US Core Smoking Status Observation Profile

div.h4: Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-observationresults

ul.li: A client has connected to a server and fetched all of a patient's laboratory results by searching by category using GET [base]/Observation?patient=[id]&category=laboratory.

A client has connected to a server and fetched all of a patient's laboratory results searching by category code and date range using GET [base]/Observation?patient=[id]&category=laboratory&date=[date]{&date=[date]}.
A client has connected to a server and fetched all of all of a patient's laboratory results searching by category and code using GET [base]/Observation?patient=[id]&category=laboratory&code=[LOINC].

A client SHOULD be capable of connecting to a server and fetching any of a patient's laboratory results searching by category and one or more codes and date range using GET [base]/Observation?patient=[id]&category=laboratory&code=[LOINC1{,LOINC2,LOINC3,...}]&date=[date]{&date=[date]}.

div.h4: Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-smokingstatus

ul.li: A client has connected to a server and fetched a patient's smoking status using GET [base]/Observation?patient=[id]&code=72166-2.

div.h4: Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-vitalsigns

ul.li: A client has connected to a server and fetched all of a patient's vital signs by searching by category using GET [base]/Observation?patient=[id]&category=vital-signs.

A client has connected to a server and fetched all of a patient's vital signs searching by category code and date range using GET [base]/Observation?patient=[id]&category=vital-signs&date=[date]{&date=[date]}.

A client has connected to a server and fetched any of a patient's vital signs by searching by one or more of the codes listed below using GET [base]/Observation?patient=[id]&code[vital sign LOINC{,LOINC2,LOINC3,...}].

A client SHOULD be capable of connecting to a server and fetching any of a patient's vital signs searching by one or more of the codes listed below and date range using GET [base]/Observation?patient=[id]&code=[LOINC{,LOINC2...}]vital-signs&date=[date]{&date=[date]}.

p.strong: Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-location

ul.li: A client has connected to a server and fetched a location by name using GET [base]/Location?name=[string]
A client has connected to a server and fetched a location by address using GET [base]/Location?address=[string]

li.div: The MedicationStatement and MedicationRequest resources can represent a medication, using either a code or refer to a [Medication] resource. If the Medication Resource is used in a MedicationStatement or a MedicationRequest, then the READ and SEARCH Criteria SHALL be supported. .

p.strong: Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-medicationstatement

div.p: The MedicationStatement and MedicationRequest resources can represent a medication, using either a code or refer to a Medication resource. When referencing a Medication resource, the resource may be contained or an external resource. The server application can choose any one way or more than one method, but IF the an external reference to Medication is used, the server SHALL support the include parameter for searching this element. The client application SHALL support both methods.

ul.li: A client has connected to a server and fetched a patient's medications using:

p.strong: Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-medicationrequest

div.p: The MedicationStatement and MedicationRequest resources can represent a medication, using either a code or refer to a Medication resource. When referencing a Medication resource, the resource may be contained or an external resource. The server application can choose any one way or more than one method, but IF the an external reference to Medication is used, the server SHALL support the include parameter for searching this element. The client application SHALL support both methods.

ul.li: A client has connected to a server and fetched a patient's medications using:

div.h4: Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-organization

ul.li: A client has connected to a server and fetched an organization by identifier using GET [base]/Organization?identifier=[system]|[code]
A client has connected to a server and fetched an organization by name usingGET [base]/Organization?name=[string]
A client has connected to a server and fetched an organization by address using GET [base]/Organization?address=[string]

div.h4: Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-practitioner

ul.li: A client has connected to a server and fetched a practitioner by identifier using GET [base]/Practitioner?identifier=[system]|[code]
A client has connected to a server and fetched a practitioner by name using GET [base]/Practitioner?family=[string]&given=[string]

div.h4: Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-procedure

ul.li: A client connected to a server and fetched all procedures for a patient, including current as well as historical Procedures GET/Procedure?patient=[id].
A client has connected to a server and fetched all of a patient's procedures over a specified time period using GET /Procedure?patient=[id]&date=[date]{&date=[date]}.

description.value: This profile defines the expected capabilities of the US Core Client conforming to the US Core IG.

display.value: US Core Smoking Status Observation Profile

documentation.value:
The US Core client SHOULD:

  1. Support fetching and querying of one or more US Core profile(s), using the supported RESTful interactions and search parameters declared in the US Core Server CapabilityStatement

description.value:
US Core Servers SHALL

  1. implement the security requirements documented in the US-Core IG.

documentation.value:
Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-patient

  • A client has connected to a server and fetched a patient using GET [base]/Patient/[id].
  • A client has connected to a server and searched through available Patients using at least 2 (example name and gender) of the following search parameters:
    • name
    • gender
    • birthdate

To limit overly broad search results, a client search with gender SHOULD include family and given name search parameters.
Allows discovery of existing US Core patient resources using different search criteria
Allows retrieval of a specific US Core patients by id
Allows review of changes to US Core patient instance over time
Allows retrieval of a historical version of a US Core patient instance

Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-allergintolerance

  • A client has connected to a server and fetched a patient's allergies using GET /AllergyIntolerance?patient=[id].
Allows discovery of existing US Core AllergyIntolerance resources using different search criteria
Allows retrieval of a specific US Core AllergyIntolerance by id
Allows review of changes to US Core AllergyIntolerance instance over time
Allows retrieval of a historical version of a US Core AllergyIntolerance instance

Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-careplan

  • A client has connected to a server and fetched all of a patient's Assessment and Plan of Treatment information using GET /CarePlan?patient=[id]&category=assess-plan.
  • A client has connected to a server and fetched all of a patient's Assessment and Plan of Treatment information over a specified time period using GET /CarePlan?patient=[id]&category=assess-plan&date=[date].
  • A client SHOULD be capable of connecting to a server and fetching all of a patient's active Assessment and Plan of Treatment information using GET /CarePlan?patient=[id]&category=assess-plan&status=active.
  • A client SHOULD be capable of connecting to a server and fetching all of a patient's active Assessment and Plan of Treatment information over a specified time period using GET /CarePlan?patient=[id]&category=assess-plan&status=active&date=[date].
Allows discovery of existing US Core careplan resources using different search criteria
Allows retrieval of a specific US Core careplan by id
Allows review of changes to US Core careplan instance over time
Allows retrieval of a historical version of a US Core careplan instance

Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-careteam

  • A client is able to connect to a server and fetch all current care team members for a patient using GET[base]/CareTeam?patient=[id]&status=active
Allows discovery of existing US Core careteam resources using different search criteria
Allows retrieval of a specific US Core careteam by id
Allows review of changes to US Core careteam instance over time

  • A client connected to a server and fetched all problems and health concerns for a patient, including current as well as historical problems and health concerns using GET/Condition?patient=[id]

  • A client has connected to a server and fetched all of a patient's goals over a specified time period using GET [base]/Goal?patient=[id]&date=[date]{&date=[date]}.

  • A client has connected to a server and fetched all of a patient's laboratory diagnostic reports by searching by category using GET [base]/DiagnosticReport?patient=[id]&category=LAB.
  • A client has connected to a server and fetched all of a patient's laboratory diagnostic reports searching by category code and date range using GET [base]/DiagnosticReport?patient=[id]&category=LAB&date=[date]{&date=[date]}.

  • A client has connected to a server and fetched all of a patient's laboratory results searching by category code and date range using GET [base]/Observation?patient=[id]&category=laboratory&date=[date]{&date=[date]}.

  • A client SHOULD be capable of connecting to a server and fetching any of a patient's laboratory results searching by category and one or more codes and date range using GET [base]/Observation?patient=[id]&category=laboratory&code=[LOINC1{,LOINC2,LOINC3,...}]&date=[date]{&date=[date]}.

Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-vitalsigns

  • A client has connected to a server and fetched all of a patient's vital signs by searching by category using GET [base]/Observation?patient=[id]&category=vital-signs.
  • A client has connected to a server and fetched all of a patient's vital signs searching by category code and date range using GET [base]/Observation?patient=[id]&category=vital-signs&date=[date]{&date=[date]}.
  • A client has connected to a server and fetched any of a patient's vital signs by searching by one or more of the codes listed below using GET [base]/Observation?patient=[id]&code[vital sign LOINC{,LOINC2,LOINC3,...}].
  • A client SHOULD be capable of connecting to a server and fetching any of a patient's vital signs searching by one or more of the codes listed below and date range using GET [base]/Observation?patient=[id]&code=[LOINC{,LOINC2...}]vital-signs&date=[date]{&date=[date]}.
Allows discovery of existing US Core resultobs resources using different search criteria
Allows retrieval of a specific US Core resultobs by id
Allows review of changes to US Core resultobs instance over time
Allows retrieval of a historical version of a US Core resultobs instance

Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-location

  • A client has connected to a server and fetched a location by name using GET [base]/Location?name=[string]
  • A client has connected to a server and fetched a location by address using GET [base]/Location?address=[string]
Allows discovery of existing US Core location resources using different search criteria.
Allows retrieval of a historical version of a US Core location instance
Allows review of changes to US Core Medication instance over time
Allows retrieval of a historical version of a US Core Medication instance

The MedicationStatement and MedicationRequest resources can represent a medication, using either a code or refer to a [Medication] resource. If the Medication Resource is used in a MedicationStatement or a MedicationRequest, then the READ and SEARCH Criteria SHALL be supported.

.
IF the Medication Resource is used in a MedicationStatement or a MedicationRequest. Allows discovery of existing US Core Medication resources using different search criteria.
IF the Medication Resource is used in a MedicationStatement or a MedicationRequest. Allows retrieval of a specific US Core Medication by id
Allows review of changes to US Core Medication instance over time
Allows retrieval of a historical version of a US Core Medication instance

Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-medicationstatement

The MedicationStatement and MedicationRequest resources can represent a medication, using either a code or refer to a Medication resource. When referencing a Medication resource, the resource may be contained or an external resource. The server application can choose any one way or more than one method, but IF the an external reference to Medication is used, the server SHALL support the include parameter for searching this element. The client application SHALL support both methods.

  • A client has connected to a server and fetched a patient's medications using:
  1. GET /MedicationStatement?patient=[id]
  2. GET /MedicationStatement?patient=[id]&_include=MedicationStatement:medication
Allows discovery of existing US Core medicationstatement resources using different search criteria
Allows retrieval of a specific US Core medicationstatement by id
Allows review of changes to US Core medicationstatement instance over time
Allows retrieval of a historical version of a US Core medicationstatement instance

Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-medicationrequest

The MedicationStatement and MedicationRequest resources can represent a medication, using either a code or refer to a Medication resource. When referencing a Medication resource, the resource may be contained or an external resource. The server application can choose any one way or more than one method, but IF the an external reference to Medication is used, the server SHALL support the include parameter for searching this element. The client application SHALL support both methods.

  • A client has connected to a server and fetched a patient's medications using:
  1. GET /MedicationRequest?patient=[id]
  2. GET /MedicationRequest?patient=[id]&_include=MedicationRequest:medication
Allows discovery of existing US Core medicationorder resources using different search criteria
Allows retrieval of a specific US Core medicationorder by id
Allows review of changes to US Core medicationorder instance over time
Allows retrieval of a historical version of a US Core medicationorder instance

Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-organization

  • A client has connected to a server and fetched an organization by identifier using GET [base]/Organization?identifier=[system]|[code]
  • A client has connected to a server and fetched an organization by name usingGET [base]/Organization?name=[string]
  • A client has connected to a server and fetched an organization by address using GET [base]/Organization?address=[string]
Allows discovery of existing US Core organization resources using different search criteria
Allows retrieval of a specific US Core organization by id
Allows review of changes to US Core organization instance over time
Allows retrieval of a historical version of a US Core organization instance

Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-practitioner

  • A client has connected to a server and fetched a practitioner by identifier using GET [base]/Practitioner?identifier=[system]|[code]
  • A client has connected to a server and fetched a practitioner by name using GET [base]/Practitioner?family=[string]&given=[string]
Allows discovery of existing US Core practitioner resources using different search criteria
Allows retrieval of a specific US Core practitioner by id
Allows review of changes to US Core practitioner instance over time
Afllows retrieval of a historical version of a US Core practitioner instance

Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-procedure

  • A client connected to a server and fetched all procedures for a patient, including current as well as historical Procedures GET/Procedure?patient=[id].
  • A client has connected to a server and fetched all of a patient's procedures over a specified time period using GET /Procedure?patient=[id]&date=[date]{&date=[date]}.
Allows discovery of existing US Core procedure resources using different search criteria
Allows retrieval of a specific US Core procedure by id
Allows review of changes to US Core procedure instance over time
Allows retrieval of a historical version of a US Core procedure instance
